Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of two added white bands; exterior: slip partly worn; tongue pattern between brown lines with black dot on interstices.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '100' is written in pencil on the exterior surface.
Bibliographic references: CVA Philadelphia II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Fasc. 29, The University Museum Philadelphia II (p. 17, pl. 5, 2e)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 307, no. 1232, pl. 160)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2019) (phase 2)
